120.value:
** Learning Lab website is a foundation skills resource for students.**

## [Art and Design](https://learninglab.rmit.edu.au/art-and-design/)

Resources to help you with critical and reflective writing, artist statements, essays and more

### [Artist statement](https://learninglab.rmit.edu.au/art-and-design/artist-statement/)

Understand the purpose of an Artist statement, identify various types, analyse real examples and practice writing in your own words. This skill helps communicate your creative practice, develop writing skills, and find your 'voice'.

### [Critical writing](https://learninglab.rmit.edu.au/art-and-design/critical-writing/)

Critical writing involves analysis and review, supported by evidence. In design, it may take the form of an essay, visual analysis or journal article.

### [Reflective writing in design](https://learninglab.rmit.edu.au/art-and-design/reflective-writing-design/)

Reflecting on practice is an important means of developing expertise in design. Structured reflection involves identifying significant events that lead to learning, identifying their value and considering how they will contribute to your future projects and your practice as a whole.


### [Propositional writing](https://learninglab.rmit.edu.au/art-and-design/propositional-writing/)

Propositional writing sets out a plan of action or design intent. It presents clearly what the project or idea is, outlines why certain actions or design elements are significant (the reasoning behind the project) and how they can be achieved.

### Other related Learning Lab resources

#### Digital portfolios 

#### [Colour Theory](https://learninglab.rmit.edu.au/art-and-design/colour-theory/)

#### [Sustainable creative practice](https://learninglab.rmit.edu.au/university-essentials/sustainability/sdgs-your-life/sustainable-creative-practice/)

value: Art (Creative Arts, Fine Arts, Visual Art)

841.value:
Contributors to the Learning Lab website include but are not limited to these individuals:
AJ Penrose, Alina Lam, Belinda Bold, , Cate O'Dwyer, Christine Ruddy, Christopher O'Connor, Colleen Boyle,  Danielle Archer, Jack Dunstan, Jacqueline Shadforth, Karen Dellar, Kelly Ann Smith, Lisa Cianci, Lyn Bond, Mare Maticevski, Matthew Millis, Meg Ivory, Peter Kennedy, Sandy Houston, Simon Evans, Sharyn Meade, Teryn Attwell, Tim O'Connor, Mike Brooks, Wol Pidriz

See humans.txt file for all contributors: https://learninglab.rmit.edu.au/humans.txt

842.value: See Learning Lab pages for specific embed codes which are at the bottom of each page

844.value:
dev site is located here: <https://lab.bitma.app> but will move to a future location on WP engine
This website has over 500 pages in total, but is being documented at a section level of granularity for ease of access & discoverability. Handling should include markdown descriptions with links to subsections for this content.

846.value: General review for currency of information and technological issues. Consider updating information, or digital media embedded content
